description.narrative:
Omprogrammerade medel för att bekämpa covid-19 Insatsens övergripande mål är att bidra till ökad jämställdhet i Etiopien. Detta planerar man göra genom att fokusera på en av de underliggande orsakerna till bristande jämställdhet i landet, nämligen våld mot kvinnor. Insatsen tar kvinnan/flickan i centrum och fokuserar insatsen på institutioner som en flicka/kvinna passerar i livet samt institutioner som kan ha en stor katalytisk effekt. Det rör sig om skolan, arbetslivet och media.
Insatsen har valt ut ett antal skolor, privata företag, offentliga institutioner och mediahus inom vilket arbetet ska pågå. Media spelar en roll som både budbärare och arbetplats. Insatsen ska genomföras i partnership med Initiative Africa som är Ambassadens avtalspart, samt Unicef och UNFPA. Insatsen finansieras gemensamt av Ambassaden/Sida, Packard Foundation och Austria Aid.
Det föreslås att Ambassaden finansierar insatsen med ett belopp om SEK 11 390 000 under perioden juli 2018- juni 2021.

Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19 The overall objective of the intervention is to strenghten gender equality in Ethiopia. The intervention will contrbute to that by addressing some of the underlying causes to gender inequality in the country; gender based violence. The intervention puts the woman/girl in the centre and will try to address violence in instituions and places where a woman/girl moves around through life and by including institution that may have positive catalytic effect on gender equality. Those are schools, workplaces and the media.
The agreement partner to the Embassy is Initiative Africa, a well known NGO with whom the Embassy has worked with before. The intervention will be jointly funded by Sweden, Packard Foundation and Austria Aid. It is proposed that Sweden contributes with an amount of SEK 11 390 000 for July 2018- Juni 2021.

The project aims to bridge the gap between civics and peace building activities especially involving the private sector. It takes a two-pronged approach that includes: (a) development of several civic education programs as a tool for peace-building; and(b) enhancement of capacity of business to handle complex conflict subject matter, especially in relation to social inequality and justice. The following objectives are identified:1. To mobilize the business community to engage in peace-building and conflict resolution actions and activities.2. Through corporate social responsibility to maintain support for effective peace building and inclusive coordination amongst Government, private sector, media actors and civil society.3. To respond to concrete challenges and opportunities to build a peaceful and just Ethiopia through civic education, training, internship and apprenticeship activities.

description.narrative: The major achievement of the cooperation partner was its agility and quick thinking on business continuity in the face of a pandemic that has affected most of the planned activities. As such, IA in close cooperation with Sweden kept on working and updating the activity plan based on the changing context of the country under State of Emergency. Major achievements include the Ministry of Education's decision to use the School Violence Index, SVI, that was developed by IA to measure gender based violence in school settings across the country. This is a major endorsement from the government's side to take forward good practices to improve the safety of students. Other achievements include the rapid assessment on SGBV increasing trends during the pandemic, gender audit of print media as well as the production of videos showcasing successful women in different areas of work and academia. These particular videos have been shared on the Embassy social media and had received one of the highest views and reaction. IA had already been engaged in voter education with the proper licensing from the National election board of Ethiopia before the House of Federation postponed the national elections. There was a field visit conducted on the first quarter of 2020 where we had the opportunity to witness a training held for first time voters in a high school in Hawassa. The cooperation partner was able to use different tools to gauge level of interests from participants and use the occasion to discuss other issues of participation that the youth were facing. Seen how the cooperation partner rose up to the challenge of adapting to fluid context, Sweden believed that extending the programme with a slightly different focus was necessary. As such a decision was taken to extend the programme with the main focus on facilitating peace building and dialogue with the engagement of the business community especially in conflict ridden areas.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
